channel.title: Programming competition?
channel.description:
What would you think about having a programming competition? We could give them a complex rule and they must make a program that we can run and then verify if their program meets the rule for a number of cases.
[b]Example:[/b] Most systems prevent users from registering with simple passwords, in order to ensure that their users are correctly protected. One rule to detect "simple" passwords is to reject the password if it contains any sequence of characters followed immediately followed by the same sentence. Make a program to check a password (1 to 10 uppercase letters), and print "Rejected" if the password is invalid, or "Accepted" if the password is valid.
[b]APPLE[/b] - Rejected (P is repeated) [b]NONONSENSE[/b] - Rejected (NO is repeated) [b]PASWORD[/b] - Accepted [b]ONION[/b] - Accepted (ON is not immediately repeated)

item.title: Programming competition?
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

Sure thing, I’m fine with it.

Read full topic

item.title: Programming competition?
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

Are we going to evaluate the code? This problem would take a few days to plan and create, I thought it would be better if we were to simply have a list of passwords that we would test their program with, and we award the first person to provide us with a fully functioning solution with the winning spot.

Read full topic

item.title: Programming competition?
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

Good idea. I feel it only right to have judges and a sample code to base it off of as well, though.

Read full topic
